page.title: 10CLOSURE OF THE BEET FACTORY
page.content: The closure of the Ely Sugar Beet Factory on the 19_2_81 dealt a blow to our area's employment. It meant the loss of 215 full time jobs and 130 casual workmen employed during the "Campaign" from September to February when the beet is harvested and processed. The National Union of Agricultural and Allied Workers were strongly opposed to its closing but they knew their case was hopeless.The British Sugar Corporation said that the factory had to close because it was too small,the machinery was out-of-date and it produced only raw sugar.They had already modernised three larger factories within a fifty mile radius.The employees were given redundancy payments or their company pensions.
